description: Documentation of evaluation performed against the Common Criteria (CC) and the Common Evaluation Methodology (CEM) standards, demonstrating that the ICT product or protection profile was evaluated in accordance with these mandatory standards
auditor_questions: Show me the evaluation documentation confirming use of Common Criteria and Common Evaluation Methodology
Which version of the Common Criteria and CEM was used for the evaluation?
How does the evaluation align with the state-of-the-art documents listed in Annex I?
Were any deviations from standard evaluation methods approved by the national certification authority?

maturity_levels.basic: Evaluation completed using CC and CEM standards with basic documentation
maturity_levels.intermediate: Full CC/CEM compliance, state-of-the-art documents applied, evaluation results clearly documented
maturity_levels.advanced: Continuous alignment with latest CC/CEM versions, proactive engagement with ECCG on state-of-the-art updates

description: EUCC certificate specifying the assurance level (substantial corresponding to AVA_VAN 1-2, or high corresponding to AVA_VAN 3-5), distinguishing conformant and augmented use of assurance components as specified in Common Criteria
auditor_questions: Show me the EUCC certificate with the assigned assurance level and AVA_VAN level
What is the justification for the selected AVA_VAN level in relation to the product risk profile?
Does the certificate distinguish between conformant and augmented use of assurance components?
For AVA_VAN 4 or 5, was the product covered by a technical domain in Annex I or a certified protection profile in Annex II?

maturity_levels.basic: EUCC certificate obtained at appropriate assurance level
maturity_levels.intermediate: Assurance level justified against risk assessment, augmented components documented, technical domain compliance verified
maturity_levels.advanced: Highest applicable AVA_VAN level achieved, comprehensive augmented assurance, proactive recertification planning

requirement_summary: Security target definition and certification method
description: Security target defining the security requirements, objectives, and functional specifications of the ICT product, either as defined by the applicant or incorporating a certified protection profile where the product falls in a covered category
auditor_questions: Show me the security target for the certified ICT product
Does the security target incorporate a certified protection profile where applicable?
How were security functional requirements and security assurance requirements determined?
How does the security target address the operational environment and threat model?

maturity_levels.basic: Security target defined with basic security requirements and objectives
maturity_levels.intermediate: Security target aligned with certified protection profile, comprehensive threat model, clear security functional requirements
maturity_levels.advanced: Security target based on rigorous threat analysis, protection profile conformance verified, formal methods applied where applicable

description: Evaluation technical report from an accredited Information Technology Security Evaluation Facility (ITSEF), documenting evaluation activities including vulnerability assessment, independent functional testing, and compliance with state-of-the-art documents and certified protection profiles
auditor_questions: Show me the ITSEF evaluation technical report for this product
What vulnerability assessment (AVA_VAN) level was applied and what were the findings?
Were all applicable state-of-the-art documents from Annex I applied in the evaluation?
For AVA_VAN 4-5, was an exception approved by the national cybersecurity certification authority?

maturity_levels.basic: ITSEF evaluation completed with evaluation technical report produced
maturity_levels.intermediate: Comprehensive vulnerability assessment, all Annex I state-of-the-art documents applied, independent functional testing performed
maturity_levels.advanced: Advanced penetration testing at highest AVA_VAN levels, composite product evaluation where applicable, formal approval from NCCA

description: Complete certification application package including all evidence required by Common Criteria sections on Developer action elements, details on ICT product and source code, vulnerability management and disclosure procedures, and supplementary cybersecurity information as required by Article 55 of the Cybersecurity Act
auditor_questions: Show me the complete certification application package with all required evidence
Does the package include vulnerability management and vulnerability disclosure procedures?
Where prior certification results are reused, show evidence of their pertinence and authenticity
How is all relevant documentation retained for the required 5-year period after certificate expiry?

maturity_levels.basic: Application package complete with all required evidence and vulnerability disclosure procedures
maturity_levels.intermediate: Prior certification results leveraged where applicable, documentation well-organised, 5-year retention assured
maturity_levels.advanced: Streamlined application process, automated evidence collection, comprehensive vulnerability management programme, proactive disclosure

description: Vulnerability assessment report documenting the systematic analysis performed during certification, including identification of known vulnerabilities, assessment of exploitability, and verification that the ICT product resists attacks commensurate with the targeted AVA_VAN level
auditor_questions: Show me the vulnerability assessment report for this certified product
How were known vulnerabilities identified and assessed for exploitability?
Does the product resist attacks at the level commensurate with the targeted AVA_VAN level?
What methodology was used for vulnerability scanning and penetration testing?

maturity_levels.basic: Vulnerability assessment completed at required AVA_VAN level with findings documented
maturity_levels.intermediate: Comprehensive vulnerability analysis including public vulnerability databases, systematic exploitability assessment
maturity_levels.advanced: Advanced attack simulation at state-of-the-art level, zero-day vulnerability research, continuous vulnerability monitoring post-certification

description: Documentation of certificate management processes including certificate issuance, validity monitoring, suspension conditions, withdrawal criteria, renewal planning, and notification procedures for changes affecting certificate compliance
auditor_questions: Show me your certificate lifecycle management plan including suspension and withdrawal criteria
How do you monitor and report changes that could affect the validity of the certificate?
What is your process for certificate renewal before expiry?
How are certificate holders notified of suspension or withdrawal decisions?

maturity_levels.basic: Certificate lifecycle tracked, basic renewal planning in place
maturity_levels.intermediate: Proactive change monitoring, structured suspension/withdrawal criteria, renewal initiated well before expiry
maturity_levels.advanced: Automated certificate lifecycle management, real-time compliance monitoring, continuous re-evaluation triggers

description: Documented procedures for managing patches and updates to certified ICT products, ensuring that patches do not invalidate the certification, including impact assessment of changes, re-evaluation triggers, and coordination with the certification body and ITSEF for assessing whether updated evaluation is needed
auditor_questions: Show me your patch management procedure for certified ICT products
How do you assess whether a patch or update impacts the validity of the EUCC certificate?
What triggers a re-evaluation by the ITSEF after a patch is applied?
How do you coordinate with the certification body to determine if the updated evaluation technical report is required?

maturity_levels.basic: Patch management procedure exists with basic impact assessment for certified products
maturity_levels.intermediate: Structured impact assessment methodology, clear re-evaluation triggers defined, certification body coordination documented
maturity_levels.advanced: Automated patch impact analysis against security target, continuous coordination with ITSEF, rapid re-certification pipeline
